title.rendered: Safety First: 4 Golden Rules For Dryer Vent Cleaning in Texas

content.rendered:
Is your dryer vent not working as efficiently as it used to? Does it take longer than usual to dry your clothes? If so, it might be a poignant idea for you to clean your dryer vent.

A dirty, clogged-up dryer vent can not only increase your utility bill but increase the risk of dryer fires, which are responsible for several deaths and injuries every year. In this post, we will talk about four safety precautions you need to take while cleaning your dryer vent. Consider these the golden rules that any good Texas dryer vent cleaner will advise you.

1. Switch off the Power

It might sound so obvious, but many people forget to do it. It is – as any Texas dryer vent cleaner can tell you – very dangerous. So, make sure you unplug the cord or turn off the gas before you start cleaning.

2. Wear a Mask

If you have not cleaned your dryer vent for a long time, it might be filled with lint, dirt, hair, and other particles that might be harmful to you to breathe in. So, make sure you wear a mask for the sake of your health.

3. Do Not Bend the Duct Too Much

Bending the duct in weird angles is not a good idea, as it can make it easier for lint particles to accumulate in the crevices. Therefore, handle it with care.

4. Attach the Vent Hose Properly

Make sure the vent is attached properly – especially if you have a gas dryer. If it is not securely attached, it can result in the buildup of carbon monoxide, which is poisonous.

It should be noted that despite your best efforts, you might not be able to clean your dryer vent as thoroughly as it needs to be cleaned. Especially, if your dryer has a long duct, it might not be possible for you to clean it with the basic equipment that you have. This is why it’s judicious to hire a professional to get your dryer vent cleaned.

The Advantages of Hiring a Texas Dryer Vent Cleaner

Dryer vent cleaners are professionals who have the expertise and training to clean dryer vents the right way. They know what needs to be done and how it needs to be done. They can do a better, more thorough job than you can due to their experience.

A seasoned Texas dryer vent cleaner can not only clean your vent but also inspect it for other problems that might affect the machine’s efficiency or put your safety and wellbeing at risk. Fixing these problems can not only save you a lot of money in repairs down the line but also increase your dryer vent’s lifespan.

Need to Get Your Dryer Vent Cleaned? We Can Help You!

At United Home Services, we have over 20 years of experience in dryer vent inspection, cleaning, and repair. We have a team of licensed technicians who are certified, bonded, and insured. They can clean your dryer vent, inspect your dryer for cracks, tears, and other problems, and fix them so that your dryer runs more efficiently.

To find out how our Texas dryer vent cleaners can help you, call us today at 624-494-1164 or contact us online and schedule a free inspection.
